definitions.definition: to (cause different substances to) combine, so that the result cannot easily be separated into its parts:
examples: Oil and water don't mix. Even if you shake them together they separate into two layers.

definitions.definition: to have or do two or more things, such as activities or qualities, at the same time:
examples: Some people are happy to mix business with/and pleasure, but I'm not one of them.
There was an odd mix of people at Patrick's party.

definitions.definition: something that is sold in the form of a powder to which a liquid, such as water, can be added later:
